data.meanings: To excoriate, pare a thong of leather, flay (sheep), strip off superficial part (e.g. peel, bark, etc..)
data.sentence: The word حُمُرٌ comes from the root ح م ر and is associated with the meanings: To excoriate, pare a thong of leather, flay (sheep), strip off superficial part (e.g. peel, bark, etc..)

data.meanings: to run away from fight, go forth from any business (as from war), march, grow wild, restive.
data.sentence: The word مُسْتَنْفِرَةٌ comes from the root ن ف ر and is associated with the meanings: to run away from fight, go forth from any business (as from war), march, grow wild, restive.
